item.vehicle.spray_can.info: Use this spray can to paint vehicles. To add a color to the spray can, combine it with one or more dyes in a crafting table. You can also refill spray cans by placing them with a non-colored spray can in a crafting table.
item.vehicle.jerry_can.info: Use this Jerry Can to transport and fill vehicles with Fuelium. It can hold the equivalent of 5 buckets of Fuelium.
item.vehicle.industrial_jerry_can.info: Use this Industrial Jerry Can to transport and fill vehicles with Fuelium. It can hold the equivalent of 15 buckets of Fuelium.
vehicle.info_help: 按住 Shift 顯示資訊
tile.vehicle.boost_pad.info: Drive on this Boost Pad to give your vehicle a speed boost!
tile.vehicle.boost_ramp.info: Drive on this Boost Ramp to give your vehicle a speed boost and send it flying!
tile.vehicle.steep_boost_ramp.info: Drive on this Steep Boost Ramp to give your vehicle a speed boost and send it flying high into the air!
tile.vehicle.traffic_cone.info: Use this cone to block vehicles with it's extra collision height. It can also be used as a hat!
tile.vehicle.fluid_pipe.info: Use this pipe to transport fluids. The gray line on the pipe indicates the direction of travel. Fluid must be initially pumped in with a Fluid Pump or any other compatible pump for it to work. Pipe can be disabled with a direct redstone signal.
tile.vehicle.fluid_pump.info: Use this pump to extract fluid from any compatible fluid storage into a pipe or another fluid storage. For the pump to work, it must be directly powered by redstone.
tile.vehicle.fuel_drum.info: This Fuel Drum can be used to store Fuelium or any other fluid. It is highly explosive, so keep it away from fire.
tile.vehicle.vehicle_crate.info: A crate containing a %s. To open the crate, simply right click the top with a wrench.
vehicle.config.title: MrCrayfish's Vehicle Mod Config
vehicle.config.client.debug.render_outli: If true, renders an outline of all the elements on a vehicle's model. Useful for debugging interactions.
vehicle.config.client.debug.raytracer.co: If true, the raytracer will be reloaded each tick.
vehicle.config.client.interaction.left_c: If true, raytraces will be performed on nearby vehicles when left-clicking the mouse, rather than just right-clicking it. This allows one to be damaged/broken when clicking anywhere on it, rather than just on its bounding box.
vehicle.config.client.display.speedomete: If true, displays a speedometer on the HUD when driving a vehicle
vehicle.config.client.display.auto_persp: If true, automatically switches to third person when mounting vehicles
vehicle.config.client.display.workstatio: If true, an animation is performed while cycling vehicles in the workstation
vehicle.config.client.controller.tooltip: Configuration options for controller support (Must have Controllable install)
vehicle.config.client.controller.use_tri: If true, will use the triggers on controller to control the acceleration of the vehicle.
vehicle.config.server.fuel_enabled.toolt: If true, vehicles will require fuel for them to be driven.
vehicle.config.server.vehicle_damage.too: If true, vehicles will take damage.
vehicle.config.server.trailer_detach_thr: The distance before the trailer detaches from a vehicle
vehicle.config.server.trailer_sync_coold: The amount of ticks to wait before syncing data to clients about the trailer connection. This is important for smooth trailer movement on client side.
vehicle.config.server.trailer_inventory_: The amount of ticks to wait before syncing trailer inventory to tracking clients. If the value is set to 0 or less, the inventory will not sync and will save on network usage.
vehicle.config.server.pick_up_vehicles.t: Allows players to pick up vehicles by crouching and right clicking
The maximum distance before the hose from the gas pump or fluid hose breaks
vehicle.status.invalid_owner: You are not the owner of this vehicle
vehicle.status.key_added: Vehicle successfully locked with this key
vehicle.status.key_invalid: This key does not fit this vehicle
